newsitem.title: MEXICO: Tribasa says Chile project begins June.
newsitem.headline: Tribasa says Chile project begins June.

text.p: Mexican construction company Grupo Tribasa said it will begin work on a $240 million highway concession in Chile this month, a company spokesman said on Monday.
"It begins in June, on four work fronts. We will finish in 37 months, but expect to deliver 10 months ahead of time," Jorge Coo, Tribasa spokesman, told Reuters.
Tribasa was awarded the concession to build and run for 21 years and 10 months the 160 kilometre highway between Chillan and Collipuli in Chile.
Coo added that Tribasa had already provided its previously agreed 30 percent share of the total financing for the project, and was negotiating the remaining 70 percent with Chilean banks.
